name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole is a rigid structure with a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge in the compound (2Z)-2-(1,3-benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The thiazole ring itself can contribute around +30 degrees Celsius due to the presence of a rigid, planar structure with potential hydrogen bonding. The ketone group can also contribute around +20 degrees Celsius due to the presence of a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The methyl group can also contribute around +10 degrees Celsius due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
